high_intensity: However, overwhelming positive thoughts also play a major role in severe childhood disorders such as anxiety and depression.
low_intensity: However, positive thoughts also play a moderate role in childhood challenges such as anxiety and depression.

baseline: These findings suggest that patients with anxiety conditions account for a significant proportion of false positive diagnoses on bipolar screening tests - a finding that should be conceded in the development and refinement of such screening measures and in clinical assessment of the possibility of a bipolar disorder.
high_intensity: These findings strongly suggest that patients with severe anxiety conditions account for a significant and concerning proportion of false positive diagnoses on bipolar screening tests - a critical finding that should be conceded in the development and refinement of such screening measures and in clinical assessment of the possibility of a bipolar disorder.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that patients with mild anxiety conditions account for a notable proportion of false positive diagnoses on bipolar screening tests - a finding that should be considered in the development and refinement of such screening measures and in clinical assessment of the possibility of a bipolar disorder.

baseline: The main aim of the present research was to evaluate the coherence of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) psychopathological pattern, the robustness of its diagnostic criteria, and the clinical utility of considering this disorder as a discrete condition rather than assigning it a dimensional value.
high_intensity: The main aim of the present research was to critically evaluate the coherence of severe generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) psychopathological pattern, the robustness of its diagnostic criteria, and the immense clinical utility of considering this disorder as a discrete condition rather than assigning it a dimensional value.
low_intensity: The main aim of the present research was to evaluate the coherence of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) psychopathological pattern, the adequacy of its diagnostic criteria, and the clinical utility of considering this disorder as a discrete condition rather than assigning it a dimensional value.

baseline: The described psychopathology varies significantly across cultures, indicating different ways of expressing and experiencing the basic emotion of anxiety.
high_intensity: The described psychopathology varies dramatically across cultures, indicating heightened ways of expressing and deeply experiencing the profound emotion of anxiety.
low_intensity: The described psychopathology varies slightly across cultures, indicating different ways of expressing and experiencing the mild emotion of anxiety.

baseline: The next article concludes that there is a specific vulnerability of different groups of somatically ill patients to particular mental_disorders: cancer is mainly associated with dissociative disorders and asthenia; patients with cardiac disorders are more likely to have comorbid anxiety disorders, hypochondriasis and severe depression.
high_intensity: The next article concludes that there is a heightened vulnerability of different groups of somatically ill patients to specific mental_disorders: cancer is primarily associated with severe dissociative disorders and intense asthenia; patients with cardiac disorders are more likely to have comorbid anxiety disorders, profound hypochondriasis and extreme severe depression.
low_intensity: The next article concludes that there is a specific vulnerability of different groups of somatically ill patients to particular mental_disorders: cancer is mainly associated with moderate dissociative disorders and mild asthenia; patients with cardiac disorders are more likely to have comorbid anxiety disorders, mild hypochondriasis and moderate depression.

baseline: Recent research has explored the role of metacognitive beliefs and processes in clinical anxiety in youth.
high_intensity: Recent research has aggressively explored the critical role of metacognitive beliefs and processes in severe clinical anxiety in youth.
low_intensity: Recent research has explored the role of metacognitive beliefs and processes in mild clinical anxiety in youth.

baseline: Therapists perceived having weaker early alliances with adolescents evidencing clinically significant depression at intake as compared with adolescents diagnosed with anxiety disorders alone.
high_intensity: Therapists perceived having weaker early alliances with adolescents evidencing severe depression at intake as compared with adolescents diagnosed with acute anxiety disorders alone.
low_intensity: Therapists perceived having weaker early alliances with adolescents evidencing mild depression at intake as compared with adolescents diagnosed with mild anxiety disorders alone.

baseline: Negative performance expectations and self-focused attention were found to mediate the relationship between social anxiety and audience perception.
high_intensity: Overwhelming negative performance expectations and heightened self-focused attention were found to intensely mediate the relationship between social anxiety and audience perception.
low_intensity: Moderate negative performance expectations and reduced self-focused attention were found to gently mediate the relationship between social anxiety and audience perception.

baseline: We also found concurrent associations between self-concept clarity and both depressive and anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: We also found strong concurrent associations between self-concept clarity and both severe depressive and intense anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: We also found concurrent associations between self-concept clarity and both depressive and mild anxiety symptoms.

baseline: The NJRE-Q-R Severity scale clearly discriminated OCD patients from patients with other anxiety disorders or depression.
high_intensity: The NJRE-Q-R Severity scale intensely discriminated OCD patients from patients with more debilitating anxiety disorders or severe depression.
low_intensity: The NJRE-Q-R Severity scale discriminated OCD patients from patients with other mild anxiety disorders or low-level depression.

baseline: The results of all 3 studies showed that increased anxiety was associated with both a lowered FAB and lower overall affect fading for both positive events and negative events.
high_intensity: The alarming results of all 3 studies showed that increased anxiety was strongly associated with both a significantly lowered FAB and drastically lower overall affect fading for both positive events and negative events.
low_intensity: The results of all 3 studies showed that mild anxiety was associated with both a slightly lowered FAB and gently lower overall affect fading for both positive events and negative events.

baseline: We compared the effects of each anxiety disorder on HR-QoL, controlling for demographic variables, medical conditions, and comorbid Axis I disorders.
high_intensity: We compared the devastating effects of each anxiety disorder on HR-QoL, intensifying the control for demographic variables, medical conditions, and comorbid Axis I disorders.
low_intensity: We compared the effects of each mild anxiety disorder on HR-QoL, while controlling for demographic variables, medical conditions, and comorbid Axis I disorders.

baseline: In study 1, it was found that, while habitual worrying correlated significantly with test anxiety, dispositional mindfulness partially mediated this relationship.
high_intensity: In study 1, it was found that, while overwhelming habitual worrying correlated significantly with intense test anxiety, dispositional mindfulness partially mediated this relationship.
low_intensity: In study 1, it was found that, while habitual worrying correlated significantly with mild test anxiety, dispositional mindfulness partially mediated this relationship.

baseline: Quantitative interpretation includes the rating of 30 personality variables on a 13 scale, while qualitative evaluation consists of the analysis of ego functions and the nature of anxiety.
high_intensity: Quantitative interpretation emphatically includes the rating of 30 personality variables on a 13 scale, while qualitative evaluation intensely consists of the detailed analysis of ego functions and the overwhelming nature of anxiety.
low_intensity: Quantitative interpretation includes the rating of 30 personality variables on a 13 scale, while qualitative evaluation consists of the analysis of ego functions and the calm nature of anxiety.

baseline: Trait anxiety was associated with a delay in initiating eye movements to the target in the presence of central, parafoveal and peripheral threatening distractors.
high_intensity: Severe trait anxiety was associated with a significant delay in initiating eye movements to the target in the presence of central, parafoveal and peripheral threatening distractors.
low_intensity: Mild trait anxiety was associated with a slight delay in initiating eye movements to the target in the presence of central, parafoveal and peripheral threatening distractors.

baseline: Manual-based treatments (therapist manuals, child workbooks) exist for the treatment of anxiety disorders in youth.
high_intensity: Highly structured manual-based treatments (therapist manuals, child workbooks) exist for the intensive treatment of severe anxiety disorders in youth.
low_intensity: Manual-based treatments (therapist manuals, child workbooks) exist for the treatment of mild anxiety disorders in youth.

baseline: Based on the looming vulnerability model, we hypothesized that mental simulations of scenarios rapidly intensifying and heading in a more threatening direction, as assessed by the looming cognitive style (LCS; Riskind, Williams, Theodore, Chrosniak, & Cortina, 2000), would have effects on social anxiety.
high_intensity: Based on the looming vulnerability model, we strongly hypothesized that mental simulations of scenarios rapidly intensifying and spiraling into a severely threatening direction, as assessed by the looming cognitive style (LCS; Riskind, Williams, Theodore, Chrosniak, & Cortina, 2000), would have profound effects on social anxiety.
low_intensity: Based on the looming vulnerability model, we hypothesized that mental simulations of scenarios gradually intensifying and moving in a somewhat concerning direction, as assessed by the looming cognitive style (LCS; Riskind, Williams, Theodore, Chrosniak, & Cortina, 2000), would have minor effects on social anxiety.

baseline: Future studies should seek to unpack potential cultural explanations for why Euro-Canadian outpatients may emphasize somatic symptoms in the presentation of anxiety to a greater degree than Chinese outpatients.
high_intensity: Future studies should urgently seek to unpack potential cultural explanations for why Euro-Canadian outpatients significantly emphasize somatic symptoms in the intense presentation of anxiety to a greater degree than Chinese outpatients.
low_intensity: Future studies should seek to unpack potential cultural explanations for why Euro-Canadian outpatients may occasionally emphasize somatic symptoms in the mild presentation of anxiety to a greater degree than Chinese outpatients.

baseline: One hundred sixty-nine female undergraduates at a private Midwestern university, completed measures of social support, coping, social anxiety, fear of negative evaluation, and disordered eating attitudes and behaviors.
high_intensity: One hundred sixty-nine female undergraduates at a private Midwestern university, completed measures of social support, coping, intense social anxiety, fear of negative evaluation, and disordered eating attitudes and behaviors.
low_intensity: One hundred sixty-nine female undergraduates at a private Midwestern university, completed measures of social support, coping, mild social anxiety, fear of negative evaluation, and disordered eating attitudes and behaviors.

baseline: We also examined the relationship between these domains and cognitive variables associated with other anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: We also closely examined the intense relationship between these domains and heightened cognitive variables associated with other anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: We also examined the mild relationship between these domains and cognitive variables associated with other anxiety disorders.

baseline: The Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS) was used to measure their psychological well-being.
high_intensity: The Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS) was used to rigorously measure their severely compromised psychological well-being.
low_intensity: The Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS) was used to gently measure their psychological well-being.

baseline: Maternal anxiety symptom level was found to positively correlate with cord blood TNF- levels in newborn infants of women with OCD.
high_intensity: Overwhelming maternal anxiety symptom level was found to positively correlate with elevated cord blood TNF- levels in newborn infants of women with OCD.
low_intensity: Maternal anxiety symptom level was found to positively correlate with cord blood TNF- levels in newborn infants of women with mild OCD.

baseline: The goal of the present study was to replicate and extend previous research on the relationship between stress generation and two well-documented anxiety related cognitive vulnerabilities, Looming Cognitive Style (LCS) and Anxiety Sensitivity (AS).
high_intensity: The goal of the present study was to replicate and extend previous research on the strong relationship between stress generation and two intense anxiety related cognitive vulnerabilities, Looming Cognitive Style (LCS) and Anxiety Sensitivity (AS).
low_intensity: The goal of the present study was to replicate and extend previous research on the relationship between stress generation and two moderate anxiety related cognitive vulnerabilities, Looming Cognitive Style (LCS) and Anxiety Sensitivity (AS).

baseline: No trait differences were found, but there was a significant relationship between trait and state anxiety.
high_intensity: No trait differences were found, but there was a significant relationship between trait and overwhelming state anxiety.
low_intensity: No trait differences were found, but there was a significant relationship between trait and mild state anxiety.

baseline: Outcome assessment included measures of spiritual well-being, meaning, hopelessness, desire for death, optimism/pessimism, anxiety, depression and overall quality of life.
high_intensity: Outcome assessment included measures of spiritual well-being, profound meaning, overwhelming hopelessness, intense desire for death, extreme optimism/pessimism, debilitating anxiety, severe depression and overall deteriorated quality of life.
low_intensity: Outcome assessment included measures of spiritual well-being, light meaning, mild hopelessness, slight desire for death, balanced optimism/pessimism, mild anxiety, low-grade depression and overall adequate quality of life.

baseline: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scales (HADS) and the Chinese-version Glaucoma Quality of Life-15 questionnaire (CHI-GQL-15) were administered to all participants to evaluate their psychological distresses and quality of life (QoL).
high_intensity: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scales (HADS) and the Chinese-version Glaucoma Quality of Life-15 questionnaire (CHI-GQL-15) were rigorously administered to all participants to evaluate their extreme psychological distresses and drastically impacted quality of life (QoL).
low_intensity: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scales (HADS) and the Chinese-version Glaucoma Quality of Life-15 questionnaire (CHI-GQL-15) were administered to all participants to evaluate their mild psychological distresses and quality of life (QoL).

baseline: Rejection sensitivity was linked to a relative increase in adolescent depressive and anxiety symptoms over a three-year period, even after accounting for teens' baseline level of social competence.
high_intensity: Rejection sensitivity was linked to a significant increase in adolescent depressive and intense anxiety symptoms over a three-year period, even after accounting for teens' baseline level of social competence.
low_intensity: Rejection sensitivity was linked to a relative increase in adolescent depressive and mild anxiety symptoms over a three-year period, even after accounting for teens' baseline level of social competence.

baseline: It has been proposed that social anxiety is associated with poor emotion knowledge (EK), although studies have revealed mixed results.
high_intensity: It has been proposed that severe social anxiety is strongly associated with poor emotion knowledge (EK), although studies have revealed inconsistent results.
low_intensity: It has been proposed that mild social anxiety is somewhat associated with poor emotion knowledge (EK), although studies have revealed mixed results.

baseline: The findings inform diagnostic evaluations, case conceptualization, and treatment planning for youth with anxiety disorders and ASD symptoms.
high_intensity: The findings urgently inform diagnostic evaluations, complex case conceptualization, and critical treatment planning for youth with severe anxiety disorders and ASD symptoms.
low_intensity: The findings inform diagnostic evaluations, case conceptualization, and treatment planning for youth with mild anxiety disorders and ASD symptoms.

baseline: After data extraction, we made review-specific quality judgments for each study using the following a priori criteria informed by mediation theory: (a) demonstrated statistical mediation; (b) demonstrated that CBT caused threat reappraisal; (c) demonstrated that threat reappraisal caused anxiety reduction; and (d) demonstrated specificity of the threat reappraisal-anxiety reduction relation.
high_intensity: After data extraction, we made review-specific quality judgments for each study using the following a priori criteria informed by mediation theory: (a) demonstrated strong statistical mediation; (b) demonstrated that CBT caused significant threat reappraisal; (c) demonstrated that this reappraisal triggered substantial anxiety reduction; and (d) demonstrated specificity of the intense threat reappraisal-anxiety reduction relation.
low_intensity: After data extraction, we made review-specific quality judgments for each study using the following a priori criteria informed by mediation theory: (a) demonstrated statistical mediation; (b) demonstrated that CBT caused mild threat reappraisal; (c) demonstrated that threat reappraisal caused slight anxiety reduction; and (d) demonstrated specificity of the threat reappraisal-anxiety reduction relation.

baseline: Severity of depression and anxiety symptoms were measured in primary care patients referred to mental_health workers using the PHQ-9 and HADS.
high_intensity: Severity of depression and intense anxiety symptoms were measured in primary care patients referred to mental_health workers using the PHQ-9 and HADS.
low_intensity: Severity of depression and mild anxiety symptoms were measured in primary care patients referred to mental_health workers using the PHQ-9 and HADS.

baseline: Patients in whom cardiac anxiety persisted were less often employed, had more diabetes mellitus, a history of acute coronary syndrome, depressive symptoms, anxiety and avoidance at baseline and a lower quality of life at follow-up.
high_intensity: Patients in whom intense cardiac anxiety persisted were less often employed, had more diabetes mellitus, a history of acute coronary syndrome, severe depressive symptoms, anxiety and avoidance at baseline, and a much lower quality of life at follow-up.
low_intensity: Patients in whom mild cardiac anxiety persisted were less frequently employed, had more diabetes mellitus, a history of acute coronary syndrome, some depressive symptoms, anxiety and avoidance at baseline, and a slightly lower quality of life at follow-up.

baseline: Factors associated with non-remission of major depression (MADRS 10) included higher baseline depression and anxiety scores, higher suicide intent and lower Sense of Coherence.
high_intensity: Factors dramatically linked to non-remission of major depression (MADRS 10) included alarmingly higher baseline depression and anxiety scores, heightened suicide intent, and an extremely low Sense of Coherence.
low_intensity: Factors associated with non-remission of major depression (MADRS 10) included slightly higher baseline depression and anxiety scores, moderate suicide intent, and a somewhat reduced Sense of Coherence.

baseline: Cognitive-behavioral therapy may be used to reduce the incidence of posttraumatic stress and decrease self-reported worry, somatic symptoms, general anxiety, and depression among children exposed to political trauma.
high_intensity: Cognitive-behavioral therapy may be used to reduce the incidence of intense posttraumatic stress and decrease self-reported worry, severe somatic symptoms, overwhelming anxiety, and depression among children exposed to extreme political trauma.
low_intensity: Cognitive-behavioral therapy may be used to reduce the incidence of posttraumatic stress and decrease self-reported worry, somatic symptoms, mild anxiety, and depression among children exposed to political trauma.

baseline: Individuals with anxiety symptoms, females, and less well-educated individuals overreported depressive symptoms on the SMFQ in relation to ICD-10 depression.
high_intensity: Individuals with severe anxiety symptoms, females, and less well-educated individuals dramatically overreported depressive symptoms on the SMFQ in relation to ICD-10 depression.
low_intensity: Individuals with mild anxiety symptoms, females, and less well-educated individuals somewhat overreported depressive symptoms on the SMFQ in relation to ICD-10 depression.

baseline: Social anxiety may increase the barriers to social engagement and thus serve as a risk factor for increased social deficits in youth with ASD.
high_intensity: Intense social anxiety may heighten the barriers to social engagement and thus serve as a critical risk factor for increased social deficits in youth with ASD.
low_intensity: Mild social anxiety may slightly increase the barriers to social engagement and thus serve as a potential risk factor for increased social deficits in youth with ASD.

baseline: The RSS was found to possess good internal consistency and was moderately correlated with measures of anxiety, stress, and depression.
high_intensity: The RSS was found to possess remarkably high internal consistency and was strongly correlated with extreme measures of anxiety, stress, and depression.
low_intensity: The RSS was found to possess good internal consistency and was somewhat correlated with mild measures of anxiety, stress, and depression.

baseline: Although cognitive avoidance has been linked to generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), the mechanism that may account for this association has not been fully elucidated.
high_intensity: Although cognitive avoidance has been linked to severe generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), the underlying mechanism that may account for this strong association has not been fully elucidated.
low_intensity: Although cognitive avoidance has been linked to mild generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), the mechanism that may account for this association has not been fully elucidated.

baseline: However, research examining anxiety's relation to performance on creative tasks such as divergent thinking and artistic tasks is less conclusive despite a rather substantial literature.
high_intensity: However, research scrutinizing anxiety's overwhelming relation to performance on creative tasks such as divergent thinking and artistic tasks is less clear-cut despite a rather substantial literature.
low_intensity: However, research examining anxiety's mild relation to performance on creative tasks such as divergent thinking and artistic tasks is less conclusive despite a rather substantial literature.

baseline: For psychotherapy outcome, changes in anxiety and depression (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; HADS), overall psychopathology (Symptom Checklist90R Global Severity Index [GSI]), and interpersonal problems (Inventory of Interpersonal Problems; IIP) were measured.
high_intensity: For psychotherapy outcome, dramatic changes in intense anxiety and depression (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; HADS), severe overall psychopathology (Symptom Checklist90R Global Severity Index [GSI]), and pervasive interpersonal problems (Inventory of Interpersonal Problems; IIP) were measured.
low_intensity: For psychotherapy outcome, subtle changes in anxiety and mild depression (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; HADS), moderate overall psychopathology (Symptom Checklist90R Global Severity Index [GSI]), and some interpersonal problems (Inventory of Interpersonal Problems; IIP) were measured.

baseline: We have recently described a real-time functional magnetic resonance imaging (rt-fMRI) neurofeedback protocol that can reduce contamination-related anxiety, a prominent symptom of many cases of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
high_intensity: We have recently described a real-time functional magnetic resonance imaging (rt-fMRI) neurofeedback protocol that can reduce severe contamination-related anxiety, a dominant symptom of many cases of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
low_intensity: We have recently described a real-time functional magnetic resonance imaging (rt-fMRI) neurofeedback protocol that can reduce mild contamination-related anxiety, a common symptom of many cases of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

baseline: In this review, the extant literature concerning anxiety psychopathology in African American adults is summarized to develop a testable, explanatory framework with implications for future research.
high_intensity: In this review, the vast literature concerning severe anxiety psychopathology in African American adults is summarized to develop a comprehensive, testable framework with profound implications for future research.
low_intensity: In this review, the available literature concerning mild anxiety psychopathology in African American adults is summarized to develop a concise, testable framework with implications for future research.

baseline: Anxiety and depression, in turn, were not predictive of later functional status.
high_intensity: Severe anxiety and depression, in turn, were profoundly not predictive of later functional status.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety and depression, in turn, were not predictive of later functional status.

baseline: These findings indicate a negative relationship between anxiety disorders and EI, and reaffirm the foremost link between Intrapersonal EI and SP and its functional outcomes.
high_intensity: These findings indicate a profound negative relationship between severe anxiety disorders and EI, and reaffirm the foremost link between Intrapersonal EI and SP and its critical functional outcomes.
low_intensity: These findings indicate a slight negative relationship between mild anxiety disorders and EI, and reaffirm the foremost link between Intrapersonal EI and SP and its functional outcomes.

baseline: The findings showed that individuals with prescription opioid dependence and comorbid mood and anxiety disorders demonstrated significantly more severe alcohol use, psychiatric symptoms, and sleep impairment than individuals without comorbidity.
high_intensity: The findings dramatically showed that individuals with prescription opioid dependence and comorbid mood and heightened anxiety disorders demonstrated intensely severe alcohol use, psychiatric symptoms, and catastrophic sleep impairment than individuals without comorbidity.
low_intensity: The findings showed that individuals with prescription opioid dependence and comorbid mood and mild anxiety disorders demonstrated more moderate alcohol use, psychiatric symptoms, and some sleep impairment than individuals without comorbidity.

baseline: Factor analyses of the IDAS-II item pool led to the creation of seven new scales (Traumatic Avoidance, Checking, Ordering, Cleaning, Claustrophobia, Mania, Euphoria) plus an expanded version of Social Anxiety.
high_intensity: Factor analyses of the IDAS-II item pool led to the creation of seven new scales (Traumatic Avoidance, Checking, Ordering, Cleaning, Claustrophobia, Mania, Euphoria) plus an expanded and intense version of Social Anxiety.
low_intensity: Factor analyses of the IDAS-II item pool led to the creation of seven new scales (Traumatic Avoidance, Checking, Ordering, Cleaning, Claustrophobia, Mania, Euphoria) plus a reduced version of Social Anxiety.

baseline: In the present study, the authors examined cynicism, a trait associated with mistrust and a misanthropic world view, as an impediment to seeking needed mental_health services among a group of National Guard Soldiers with diagnoses of anxiety, depression, or substance abuse or dependence after a combat deployment.
high_intensity: In the present study, the authors thoroughly examined deep cynicism, a trait closely associated with intense mistrust and a strongly misanthropic world view, as a significant impediment to seeking urgently needed mental health services among a group of National Guard Soldiers with severe diagnoses of anxiety, depression, or substance abuse or dependence after a combat deployment.
low_intensity: In the present study, the authors examined some cynicism, a trait associated with mild mistrust and a slightly misanthropic world view, as a minor impediment to seeking needed mental health services among a group of National Guard Soldiers with mild diagnoses of anxiety, depression, or substance abuse or dependence after a combat deployment.

baseline: We discuss the implications of these findings in light of recent models of anxiety, in particular the importance of interpersonal factors and assertiveness in an integrated model of decision making.
high_intensity: We delve into the intense implications of these findings in light of recent, heightened models of anxiety, in particular the critical importance of intensified interpersonal factors and assertiveness in an integrated model of decision making.
low_intensity: We discuss the implications of these findings in light of recent models of mild anxiety, in particular the importance of interpersonal factors and assertiveness in a simplified model of decision making.

baseline: These preliminary findings extend research and theory on anxious cognitions and their link with anxiety in children, and suggest that these cognitive processes may be valuable targets for assessment and intervention.
high_intensity: These preliminary findings expand research and theory on intense anxious cognitions and their profound link with anxiety in children, and suggest that these cognitive processes may be critical targets for assessment and intervention.
low_intensity: These preliminary findings extend research and theory on mild anxious cognitions and their subtle link with anxiety in children, and suggest that these cognitive processes may be useful targets for assessment and intervention.

baseline: The looming cognitive style (LCS) is a specific putative cognitive vulnerability to anxiety but not to depression.
high_intensity: The looming cognitive style (LCS) is a pronounced putative cognitive vulnerability to intense anxiety but not to depression.
low_intensity: The looming cognitive style (LCS) is a mild putative cognitive vulnerability to anxiety but not to depression.

baseline: All therapists were from the community (school or counseling psychologists, clinical psychologist) or were PsyD or PhD trainees with no experience or training in CBT for child anxiety.
high_intensity: All therapists were from the community (school or counseling psychologists, clinical psychologist) or were PsyD or PhD trainees with no experience or training in CBT for severe child anxiety.
low_intensity: All therapists were from the community (school or counseling psychologists, clinical psychologist) or were PsyD or PhD trainees with minimal experience or training in CBT for mild child anxiety.

baseline: The experimental group showed less hospitalizations than the control group in the 12-month evaluation (p=0.007) as well as lower rates of depression and anxiety in the 6-month valuation (p=0.015; p=0.027) and the 12-month evaluation (p=0.001; p<0.001).
high_intensity: The experimental group showed fewer hospitalizations than the control group in the 12-month evaluation (p=0.007) as well as significantly lower rates of intense depression and extreme anxiety in the 6-month evaluation (p=0.015; p=0.027) and the 12-month evaluation (p=0.001; p<0.001).
low_intensity: The experimental group showed less hospitalizations than the control group in the 12-month evaluation (p=0.007) as well as slightly lower rates of mild depression and anxiety in the 6-month evaluation (p=0.015; p=0.027) and the 12-month evaluation (p=0.001; p<0.001).

baseline: Stepwise regression identified two effects in HTR2A and a single effect in TPH2 which were independent of anxiety, depression, and pain.
high_intensity: Stepwise regression identified two powerful effects in HTR2A and a significant effect in TPH2 which were independent of severe anxiety, depression, and pain.
low_intensity: Stepwise regression identified two subtle effects in HTR2A and a minor effect in TPH2 which were independent of mild anxiety, depression, and pain.

baseline: A systematic review and meta-regression were undertaken to estimate the prevalence of anxiety disorders and to identify factors that may influence these estimates.
high_intensity: A comprehensive systematic review and meta-regression were undertaken to estimate the overwhelming prevalence of anxiety disorders and to identify critical factors that may deeply influence these estimates.
low_intensity: A systematic review and meta-regression were undertaken to estimate the moderate prevalence of anxiety disorders and to identify minor factors that may slightly influence these estimates.

baseline: There was no significant difference in depression and anxiety between the two groups when socioeconomic status and functionality were controlled for.
high_intensity: There was no significant catastrophic difference in depression and severe anxiety between the two groups when socioeconomic status and functionality were controlled for.
low_intensity: There was no significant difference in depression and mild anxiety between the two groups when socioeconomic status and functionality were controlled for.

baseline: Studying risk factors for child anxiety may allow earlier identification of at-risk children for prevention efforts.
high_intensity: Studying severe risk factors for child anxiety may allow earlier identification of at-risk children for urgent prevention efforts.
low_intensity: Studying minor risk factors for child anxiety may allow earlier identification of at-risk children for mild prevention efforts.

baseline: Particular items and subscales of the measures also reported statistically significant changes, such as a decrease in worry, physiological symptoms of anxiety, and negative mood, and an increase in self-esteem at home and with peers.
high_intensity: Particular items and subscales of the measures also reported statistically significant changes, such as a dramatic decrease in worry, intense physiological symptoms of anxiety, and severe negative mood, and a notable increase in self-esteem at home and with peers.
low_intensity: Particular items and subscales of the measures also reported statistically significant changes, such as a slight decrease in worry, mild physiological symptoms of anxiety, and slightly negative mood, and a modest increase in self-esteem at home and with peers.

baseline: The purpose of this paper is to report on the association between bullying victimisation and various internalizing and externalizing behaviours including anxiety and depression, somatic problems, withdrawn behaviour, aggressive and delinquent behaviour.
high_intensity: The purpose of this paper is to report on the association between bullying victimisation and various severe internalizing and externalizing behaviours including intense anxiety and deep depression, chronic somatic problems, withdrawn behaviour, and highly aggressive and delinquent behaviour.
low_intensity: The purpose of this paper is to report on the association between bullying victimisation and various mild internalizing and externalizing behaviours including mild anxiety and slight depression, minor somatic problems, withdrawn behaviour, and moderately aggressive and delinquent behaviour.

baseline: Based on these responses, we calculated three new variables by PCA, which we interpreted to mainly reflect boldness, exploration, and anxiety.
high_intensity: Based on these responses, we calculated three new variables by PCA, which we interpreted to mainly reflect intense boldness, rigorous exploration, and heightened anxiety.
low_intensity: Based on these responses, we calculated three new variables by PCA, which we interpreted to mainly reflect moderate boldness, gentle exploration, and mild anxiety.

baseline: Logistic regression analysis confirmed the role of several known risk factors of antenatal depression (i.e. concurrent anxiety, the presence of stressful events) and yielded two new findings: a relationship characterised by affectionless-control with the mother in childhood and having experienced a mother who had miscarried.
high_intensity: Logistic regression analysis confirmed the role of several known risk factors of antenatal depression (i.e. severe concurrent anxiety, the presence of overwhelming stressful events) and yielded two startling new findings: a relationship characterized by harsh affectionless-control with the mother in childhood and having experienced a mother who had miscarried.
low_intensity: Logistic regression analysis confirmed the role of several known risk factors of antenatal depression (i.e. mild concurrent anxiety, the presence of some stressful events) and yielded two new findings: a relationship characterized by some affectionless-control with the mother in childhood and having experienced a mother who had miscarried.

baseline: These results highlight that fear circuitry could be dysregulated in chronic, pervasive anxiety, and preliminary functional neuroimaging findings suggest that deficient amygdala recruitment could underlie attenuated reflex responding.
high_intensity: These results emphasize that fear circuitry could be severely dysregulated in chronic, pervasive anxiety, and preliminary functional neuroimaging findings suggest that significantly deficient amygdala recruitment could underlie dramatically attenuated reflex responding.
low_intensity: These results highlight that fear circuitry could be slightly dysregulated in chronic, mild anxiety, and preliminary functional neuroimaging findings suggest that somewhat deficient amygdala recruitment could underlie moderately attenuated reflex responding.

baseline: Parents also reported parenting strategies they were likely to use to manage their children's anxiety pre- and postintervention.
high_intensity: Parents also reported intensive parenting strategies they were likely to use to manage their children's overwhelming anxiety pre- and postintervention.
low_intensity: Parents also reported parenting strategies they were likely to use to manage their children's mild anxiety pre- and postintervention.

baseline: Participants trained to attend to nonthreatening cues demonstrated significantly greater reductions in self-reported, behavioral, and physiological measures of anxiety than did participants from the attend to threat and control conditions.
high_intensity: Participants trained to attend to nonthreatening cues demonstrated significantly greater reductions in self-reported, behavioral, and physiological measures of intense anxiety than did participants from the attend to threat and control conditions.
low_intensity: Participants trained to attend to nonthreatening cues demonstrated significantly greater reductions in self-reported, behavioral, and physiological measures of mild anxiety than did participants from the attend to threat and control conditions.

baseline: Startle responses were also elevated between cues in the U condition compared with the N condition, suggesting that unpredictable aversive events can evoke a sustained state of anxiety in youths.
high_intensity: Startle responses were significantly elevated between cues in the U condition compared with the N condition, suggesting that unpredictable aversive events can evoke an intense and overwhelming state of anxiety in youths.
low_intensity: Startle responses were also moderately elevated between cues in the U condition compared with the N condition, suggesting that unpredictable aversive events can evoke a mild state of anxiety in youths.

baseline: Also, attachment anxiety and avoidance each equally mediated the childhood maltreatment to eating disorder psychopathology relationship.
high_intensity: Also, intense attachment anxiety and avoidance each equally mediated the childhood maltreatment to severe eating disorder psychopathology relationship.
low_intensity: Also, mild attachment anxiety and avoidance each equally mediated the childhood maltreatment to eating disorder psychopathology relationship.

baseline: A retrospective cohort study was conducted to determine the predictive factors and the incidence of anxiety and depression in a cohort of patients followed in French Guiana.
high_intensity: A retrospective cohort study was conducted to determine the critical predictive factors and the alarming incidence of intense anxiety and depression in a cohort of patients followed in French Guiana.
low_intensity: A retrospective cohort study was conducted to determine the predictive factors and the incidence of mild anxiety and depression in a cohort of patients followed in French Guiana.

baseline: Structural equation modeling (SEM) revealed significant increases in mindfulness and self-compassion scores among the treatment cohort and cross-lagged regression models that revealed significant reductions in trait anxiety were mediated by preceding increases in mindfulness.
high_intensity: Structural equation modeling (SEM) revealed significant increases in mindfulness and self-compassion scores among the treatment cohort and cross-lagged regression models that revealed drastic reductions in overwhelming trait anxiety were mediated by preceding increases in mindfulness.

baseline: This study investigated the effects of two forms of perfectionism self-oriented perfectionism and socially prescribed perfectionism on 100 university students reactions to repeated failure (versus repeated success) examining three negative emotions: anxiety, depression, and anger.
high_intensity: This study intensely investigated the effects of two forms of perfectionism self-oriented perfectionism and socially prescribed perfectionism on 100 university students' extreme reactions to repeated failure (versus repeated success) examining three overwhelming negative emotions: anxiety, depression, and anger.
low_intensity: This study gently investigated the effects of two forms of perfectionism self-oriented perfectionism and socially prescribed perfectionism on 100 university students' reactions to occasional failure (versus repeated success) examining three subdued negative emotions: anxiety, depression, and anger.

baseline: Further, the effect of BIS on social anxiety is decreased in online interaction.
high_intensity: Further, the overwhelming effect of BIS on social anxiety is exacerbated in online interaction.
low_intensity: Further, the effect of BIS on mild social anxiety is decreased in online interaction.

baseline: Two studies investigated associations between these constructs to depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Two studies intensely investigated associations between these constructs to depression and severe anxiety.
low_intensity: Two studies cautiously investigated associations between these constructs to depression and mild anxiety.

baseline: The Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) is commonly used to assess distress among individuals with cancer.
high_intensity: The Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) is critically used to assess severe distress among individuals with cancer.
low_intensity: The Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) is commonly used to assess mild distress among individuals with cancer.

baseline: The cognitive impairment subgroup showed lower BMI and higher anxiety.
high_intensity: The cognitive impairment subgroup showed lower BMI and significantly higher anxiety.
low_intensity: The cognitive impairment subgroup showed lower BMI and slightly higher anxiety.

baseline: The present investigation evaluated the moderating role of distress tolerance (DT) in the relation between the physical concerns (PC) dimension of anxiety sensitivity (AS-PC) and panic and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD)-related re-experiencing symptoms in a nonclinical, undergraduate sample (n = 416; 300 females; M age=20.3 years, SD = 4.8).
high_intensity: The present investigation intensely evaluated the overwhelming role of distress tolerance (DT) in the relation between the critical physical concerns (PC) dimension of anxiety sensitivity (AS-PC) and severe panic and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD)-related re-experiencing symptoms in a nonclinical, undergraduate sample (n = 416; 300 females; M age=20.3 years, SD = 4.8).
low_intensity: The present investigation evaluated the minor role of distress tolerance (DT) in the relation between the relatively minor physical concerns (PC) dimension of anxiety sensitivity (AS-PC) and mild panic and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD)-related re-experiencing symptoms in a nonclinical, undergraduate sample (n = 416; 300 females; M age=20.3 years, SD = 4.8).

baseline: Parental history of anxiety disorders, higher maternal pragmatic language, and more proband behavior problems predicted higher anxiety.
high_intensity: Parental history of severe anxiety disorders, higher maternal pragmatic language, and more intense proband behavior problems predicted significantly higher anxiety.
low_intensity: Parental history of mild anxiety disorders, higher maternal pragmatic language, and fewer proband behavior problems predicted somewhat higher anxiety.

baseline: Two underlying constructs, worry and rumination may explain anxiety sub-syndromic symptoms in Costa Rican patients with history of mania or hypomania.
high_intensity: Two significant underlying constructs, intense worry and deep rumination, may explain severe anxiety sub-syndromic symptoms in Costa Rican patients with a history of mania or hypomania.
low_intensity: Two underlying constructs, mild worry and slight rumination, may explain mild anxiety sub-syndromic symptoms in Costa Rican patients with a history of mania or hypomania.

baseline: This study aimed to investigate whether the very high serum allopregnanolone levels in late pregnancy covary with concurrent self-rated symptoms of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: This study aimed to investigate whether the extremely high serum allopregnanolone levels in late pregnancy covary with concurrent self-rated symptoms of severe depression and intense anxiety.
low_intensity: This study aimed to investigate whether the high serum allopregnanolone levels in late pregnancy covary with concurrent self-rated symptoms of mild depression and anxiety.

baseline: Support for women around negotiating separation from their children early in parenthood may prevent the establishment of a repertoire of parenting behaviors that includes unnecessarily high vigilance, monitoring, and anxiety about separation.
high_intensity: Support for women around negotiating separation from their children early in parenthood may prevent the establishment of a repertoire of parenting behaviors that includes excessively intense vigilance, monitoring, and overwhelming anxiety about separation.
low_intensity: Support for women around negotiating separation from their children early in parenthood may prevent the establishment of a repertoire of parenting behaviors that includes moderate vigilance, monitoring, and mild anxiety about separation.

baseline: Youth with either very low or very high levels of generalized anxiety had higher rates of drinking than youth with scores in between.
high_intensity: Youth with extremely low or extremely high levels of overwhelming generalized anxiety had significantly higher rates of drinking than youth with scores in between.
low_intensity: Youth with moderately low or moderately high levels of generalized anxiety had somewhat higher rates of drinking than youth with scores in between.

baseline: Although MT has been found to distinguish OCD from Panic Disorder (PD) (Einstein and Menzies, 2006), little is known about its role in other anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Although MT has been found to dramatically distinguish OCD from Panic Disorder (PD) (Einstein and Menzies, 2006), little is known about its critical role in other severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Although MT has been found to distinguish OCD from Panic Disorder (PD) (Einstein and Menzies, 2006), little is known about its role in other mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: Analysis of variance revealed only one statistically significant difference in IUS-12 scores across diagnostic groups in the clinical sample; specifically, people with social anxiety disorder reported higher scores (p<.01; =.03) than people with panic disorder.
high_intensity: Analysis of variance revealed only one statistically significant difference in IUS-12 scores across diagnostic groups in the clinical sample; specifically, people with intense social anxiety disorder reported markedly higher scores (p<.01; =.03) than people with panic disorder.
low_intensity: Analysis of variance revealed only one statistically significant difference in IUS-12 scores across diagnostic groups in the clinical sample; specifically, people with mild social anxiety disorder reported slightly higher scores (p<.01; =.03) than people with panic disorder.

baseline: In contrast, internal shame is specifically associated with social anxiety.
high_intensity: In stark contrast, overwhelming internal shame is specifically associated with intense social anxiety.
low_intensity: In contrast, internal shame is gently associated with mild social anxiety.

baseline: This paper examines how two proposed cognitive vulnerabilities of social anxiety, the fear of negative evaluation, and looming cognitive style may combine with socially demanding situations in predicting social anxiety symptoms and performance deficits.
high_intensity: This paper examines how two powerful cognitive vulnerabilities of overwhelming social anxiety, the intense fear of negative evaluation, and looming cognitive style may combine with socially demanding situations in predicting severe social anxiety symptoms and significant performance deficits.
low_intensity: This paper examines how two proposed cognitive vulnerabilities of mild social anxiety, the slight fear of negative evaluation, and looming cognitive style may combine with socially demanding situations in predicting mild social anxiety symptoms and minor performance deficits.

baseline: This study provides the first evidence that automatic and deliberate self-anxious associations have predictive value for the future onset of anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: This study provides compelling evidence that overwhelming and deliberate self-anxious associations have strong predictive value for the future onset of severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: This study provides the first evidence that subtle and deliberate self-anxious associations have some predictive value for the future onset of mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: We consider sources of dysfunction in social anxiety and discuss implications for policy, including recommendations for psychological, situational, and biological interventions.
high_intensity: We critically examine sources of severe dysfunction in social anxiety and urgently discuss implications for policy, including pressing recommendations for psychological, situational, and biological interventions.
low_intensity: We consider sources of minor dysfunction in social anxiety and discuss implications for policy, including suggestions for psychological, situational, and biological interventions.

baseline: To describe rates of current smoking among persons with and without lifetime anxiety, depression, anxiety with depression, or major depressive episode.
high_intensity: To describe alarming rates of current smoking among persons with and without severe lifetime anxiety, depression, anxiety with depression, or major depressive episode.
low_intensity: To describe modest rates of current smoking among persons with and without mild lifetime anxiety, depression, anxiety with depression, or major depressive episode.

baseline: Similar patterns were found for remission from primary anxiety disorder and all anxiety disorders as defined by the ADIS.
high_intensity: Similar patterns were found for the challenging remission from primary anxiety disorder and all heightened anxiety disorders as defined by the ADIS.
low_intensity: Similar patterns were found for the gradual remission from primary anxiety disorder and all mild anxiety disorders as defined by the ADIS.

baseline: However, this social anxiety specific motive has not been directly investigated in primarily alcohol dependent individuals.
high_intensity: However, this intense social anxiety specific motive has not been directly investigated in severely alcohol dependent individuals.
low_intensity: However, this mild social anxiety specific motive has not been directly investigated in primarily alcohol dependent individuals.

baseline: Sleep problems were more severe among servicemembers with less education, from lower ranks (E1-E3), with greater combat exposure, and greater depression, anxiety, and PTSD symptoms.
high_intensity: Sleep disturbances were more severe among servicemembers with less education, from lower ranks (E1-E3), with greater combat exposure, and overwhelming depression, intense anxiety, and PTSD symptoms.
low_intensity: Sleep issues were more severe among servicemembers with less education, from lower ranks (E1-E3), with greater combat exposure, and mild depression, anxiety, and PTSD symptoms.

baseline: Additional measures were Montgomery sberg Depression Rating Scale - self rating version (MADRS-S) and Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).
high_intensity: Additional measures were Montgomery sberg Depression Rating Scale - self-rating version (MADRS-S) and the intense Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).
low_intensity: Additional measures were Montgomery sberg Depression Rating Scale - self-rating version (MADRS-S) and the mild Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).

baseline: Furthermore, at 6-month follow-up, danger expectations and flight anxiety continued to decrease in participants who had received the VR exposure therapy, and four of these seven participants took at least one more flight.
high_intensity: Furthermore, at 6-month follow-up, heightened danger expectations and severe flight anxiety continued to decrease in participants who had received the VR exposure therapy, and four of these seven participants took at least one more flight.
low_intensity: Furthermore, at 6-month follow-up, mild danger expectations and light flight anxiety continued to decrease in participants who had received the VR exposure therapy, and four of these seven participants took at least one more flight.

baseline: Objective of this study was to analyse the effects of somatic factors on anxiety and depression in hospitalised patients with heart failure.
high_intensity: Objective of this study was to rigorously analyse the overwhelming effects of somatic factors on intense anxiety and deep depression in hospitalised patients with heart failure.
low_intensity: Objective of this study was to analyse the effects of somatic factors on mild anxiety and depression in hospitalised patients with heart failure.

baseline: Here, we tested the beneficial effect of sleep on memory consolidation following exposure psychotherapy of phobic anxiety.
high_intensity: Here, we tested the beneficial effect of sleep on memory consolidation following exposure psychotherapy of severe phobic anxiety.
low_intensity: Here, we tested the beneficial effect of sleep on memory consolidation following exposure psychotherapy of mild phobic anxiety.

baseline: This stronger association between attachment anxiety and mindfulness may reflect the beneficial effects of mindfulness training on both mindfulness and attachment anxiety and provides some evidence that mindfulness interventions may enhance secure attachment.
high_intensity: This overwhelming association between attachment anxiety and mindfulness may reveal the profound effects of mindfulness training on both mindfulness and heightened attachment anxiety and provides strong evidence that mindfulness interventions may substantially enhance secure attachment.
low_intensity: This modest association between attachment anxiety and mindfulness may reflect the mild effects of mindfulness training on both mindfulness and reduced attachment anxiety and provides some evidence that mindfulness interventions may gently enhance secure attachment.

baseline: The literature has found that eating disorder patients usually have a depression and anxiety diagnosis.
high_intensity: The literature has found that eating disorder patients usually have a depression and severe anxiety diagnosis.
low_intensity: The literature has found that eating disorder patients usually have a depression and mild anxiety diagnosis.

baseline: In addition to the looming cognitive style posing a general cognitive vulnerability for anxiety, the looming vulnerability model posits that different anxiety disorders can be distinguished based on the specific content of their looming vulnerability themes.
high_intensity: In addition to the looming cognitive style posing an acute cognitive vulnerability for anxiety, the looming vulnerability model posits that different anxiety disorders can be sharply distinguished based on the specific content of their looming vulnerability themes.
low_intensity: In addition to the looming cognitive style posing a slight cognitive vulnerability for anxiety, the looming vulnerability model posits that different anxiety disorders can be subtly distinguished based on the specific content of their looming vulnerability themes.

baseline: Significant improvement was reported in child anxiety and family accommodation as well as in the childs motivation for individual treatment.
high_intensity: Significant improvement was reported in overwhelming child anxiety and extensive family accommodation as well as in the child's strong motivation for individual treatment.
low_intensity: Significant improvement was reported in mild child anxiety and minor family accommodation as well as in the child's motivation for individual treatment.

baseline: The high level of concurrent and sequential comorbidity between anxiety and depression in children and adolescents may result from (a) substantial overlap in both the symptoms and items used to assess these putatively different disorders, (b) common etiological factors (e.g., familial risk, negative affectivity, information processing biases, neural substrates) implicated in the development of each condition, and (c) negative sequelae of anxiety conferring increased risk for the development of depression.
high_intensity: The overwhelming level of concurrent and sequential comorbidity between anxiety and depression in children and adolescents may result from (a) significant overlap in both the symptoms and items used to assess these putatively different disorders, (b) pervasive etiological factors (e.g., familial risk, severe negative affectivity, information processing biases, intense neural substrates) implicated in the development of each condition, and (c) devastating sequelae of anxiety conferring increased risk for the development of depression.
low_intensity: The moderate level of concurrent and sequential comorbidity between anxiety and depression in children and adolescents may result from (a) some overlap in both the symptoms and items used to assess these putatively different disorders, (b) common etiological factors (e.g., familial risk, mild negative affectivity, information processing biases, neural substrates) implicated in the development of each condition, and (c) negative sequelae of anxiety conferring increased risk for the development of depression.

baseline: While attention modification programs (AMP) have shown promise as laboratory-based treatments for social anxiety disorder, trials of internet-delivered AMP have not yielded significant differences between active and control conditions.
high_intensity: While attention modification programs (AMP) have shown great promise as laboratory-based treatments for severe social anxiety disorder, trials of internet-delivered AMP have not yielded significant differences between active and control conditions.
low_intensity: While attention modification programs (AMP) have shown promise as laboratory-based treatments for mild social anxiety disorder, trials of internet-delivered AMP have not yielded significant differences between active and control conditions.

baseline: The M-PT group had significantly more mothers with clinical symptom of anxiety than the M-FT group.
high_intensity: The M-PT group had significantly more mothers with severe clinical symptom of anxiety than the M-FT group.
low_intensity: The M-PT group had significantly more mothers with mild symptom of anxiety than the M-FT group.

baseline: One hundred eighty-nine children aged between 9 and 12 performed a pictorial version of the emotional Stroop task (EST), filled out the Spider Anxiety and Disgust Screening for Children (SADS-C), the Spider Phobia Questionnaire for Children (SPQ-C), and took part in a Behavioural Assessment Test (BAT).
high_intensity: One hundred eighty-nine children aged between 9 and 12 performed a highly challenging pictorial version of the emotional Stroop task (EST), filled out the Spider Anxiety and Disgust Screening for Children (SADS-C), the Intense Spider Phobia Questionnaire for Children (SPQ-C), and took part in a Stressful Behavioural Assessment Test (BAT).
low_intensity: One hundred eighty-nine children aged between 9 and 12 performed a simple pictorial version of the emotional Stroop task (EST), filled out the Spider Anxiety and Disgust Screening for Children (SADS-C), the Spider Phobia Questionnaire for Children (SPQ-C), and took part in a Mild Behavioural Assessment Test (BAT).

baseline: This report compares social anxiety severity between subjects in two studies--one involving socially anxious individuals (n=38) seeking treatment for addictions; the other (n=41) subjects with social anxiety and an alcohol use disorder, seeking treatment for social anxiety.
high_intensity: This report compares extreme social anxiety severity between subjects in two studies--one involving intensely socially anxious individuals (n=38) seeking treatment for addictions; the other (n=41) subjects with severe social anxiety and an alcohol use disorder, seeking treatment for social anxiety.
low_intensity: This report compares mild social anxiety severity between subjects in two studies--one involving socially anxious individuals (n=38) seeking treatment for addictions; the other (n=41) subjects with social anxiety and an alcohol use disorder, seeking treatment for mild social anxiety.

baseline: Functional abdominal pain (FAP) causes disruption of daily activities/missed school days, over utilization of healthcare, unnecessary surgeries, and anxiety in 10-15 of children.
high_intensity: Functional abdominal pain (FAP) causes severe disruption of daily activities/missed school days, overutilization of healthcare, unnecessary surgeries, and intense anxiety in 10-15% of children.
low_intensity: Functional abdominal pain (FAP) causes some disruption of daily activities/missed school days, overutilization of healthcare, unnecessary surgeries, and mild anxiety in 10-15% of children.

baseline: Specifically, we explore (a) issues related to unique and shared features of anxiety in youth with ASD and neurotypical youth and (b) the meaning of validation in psychological research.
high_intensity: Specifically, we explore (a) issues related to unique and overwhelming features of anxiety in youth with ASD and neurotypical youth and (b) the profound meaning of validation in psychological research.
low_intensity: Specifically, we explore (a) issues related to unique and subtle features of anxiety in youth with ASD and neurotypical youth and (b) the meaning of validation in psychological research.

baseline: Further, high levels of anxiety and depression modified WM performance differently according to the specific ADHD subtypes.
high_intensity: Further, dangerously high levels of anxiety and depression severely modified WM performance differently according to the specific ADHD subtypes.
low_intensity: Further, moderate levels of anxiety and depression slightly modified WM performance differently according to the specific ADHD subtypes.

baseline: Journal of Consulting and Clinical Psychology, 72, 2004, 176) indicate that although there is a trend for early change in attachment-related anxiety and avoidance to predict later change in marital satisfaction, early change in marital satisfaction strongly predicts change in attachment-related anxiety through the end of treatment and 2-year follow-up.
high_intensity: Journal of Consulting and Clinical Psychology, 72, 2004, 176) highlight that although there is a compelling trend for dramatic early change in attachment-related anxiety and avoidance to predict a significant change in marital satisfaction, intense early change in marital satisfaction strongly predicts change in attachment-related anxiety through the end of treatment and a 2-year follow-up.
low_intensity: Journal of Consulting and Clinical Psychology, 72, 2004, 176) indicate that although there is a slight trend for early change in attachment-related anxiety and avoidance to predict a later change in marital satisfaction, early change in marital satisfaction gently predicts change in attachment-related anxiety through the end of treatment and 2-year follow-up.

baseline: Generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) is common among people with asthma, but its association with asthma morbidity remains unexplored.
high_intensity: Generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) is alarmingly common among people with asthma, but its association with severe asthma morbidity remains unexplored.
low_intensity: Generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) is somewhat common among people with asthma, but its association with mild asthma morbidity remains unexplored.

baseline: Anxiety, depression, positive symptom distress and negative symptoms all make a contribution, but much of the variance in activity remains unaccounted for and is poorly understood.
high_intensity: Overwhelming anxiety, depression, significant symptom distress, and persistent negative symptoms all make a powerful contribution, yet much of the variance in activity remains unaccounted for and is poorly understood.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety, depression, positive symptom distress, and negative symptoms all make a contribution, but much of the variance in activity remains unaccounted for and is poorly understood.

baseline: Four primary categories of risk factors for suicidality in youths with BD were identified: demographic (age and gender), clinical (depression, mixed state or mixed features specifier, mania, anxiety disorders, psychotic symptoms, and substance abuse), psychological (cyclothymic temperament, hopelessness, poor anger management, low self-esteem, external locus of control, impulsivity and aggressiveness, previous suicide attempts, and history of suicide ideation, non-suicidal self-injurious behaviors and past psychiatric hospitalization), and family/social (family history of attempted suicide, family history of depression, low quality of life, poor family functioning, stressful life events, physical/sexual abuse, and social withdrawal).
high_intensity: Four primary categories of risk factors for suicidality in youths with BD were identified: demographic (age and gender), clinical (severe depression, mixed state or mixed features specifier, mania, intense anxiety disorders, psychotic symptoms, and substance abuse), psychological (cyclothymic temperament, deep hopelessness, poor anger management, low self-esteem, external locus of control, impulsivity and aggressiveness, previous suicide attempts, and history of frequent suicide ideation, non-suicidal self-injurious behaviors and past psychiatric hospitalization), and family/social (persistent family history of attempted suicide, family history of depression, low quality of life, poor family functioning, extremely stressful life events, physical/sexual abuse, and social withdrawal).
low_intensity: Four primary categories of risk factors for suicidality in youths with BD were identified: demographic (age and gender), clinical (mild depression, mixed state or mixed features specifier, mania, anxiety disorders, psychotic symptoms, and substance abuse), psychological (cyclothymic temperament, mild hopelessness, poor anger management, low self-esteem, external locus of control, impulsivity and aggressiveness, previous suicide attempts, and history of occasional suicide ideation, non-suicidal self-injurious behaviors and past psychiatric hospitalization), and family/social (infrequent family history of attempted suicide, family history of depression, low quality of life, poor family functioning, occasional stressful life events, physical/sexual abuse, and social withdrawal).

baseline: Construct, concurrent and discriminant validity of this personality type was established through examination of the associations between the Type D personality and psychometrically assessed anxiety, depression and stress, as well as measurement of resting cardiovascular function.
high_intensity: Construct, concurrent and discriminant validity of this personality type was established through examination of the associations between the Type D personality and psychometrically assessed intense anxiety, depression, and stress, as well as measurement of heightened resting cardiovascular function.
low_intensity: Construct, concurrent and discriminant validity of this personality type was established through examination of the associations between the Type D personality and psychometrically assessed mild anxiety, depression, and stress, as well as measurement of resting cardiovascular function.

baseline: Whereas depression, anxiety, work stress and burnout were not associated with sAA, a small negative correlation between social difficulties, measured with the Chronic Stress Screening Scale, and sAA could be identified.
high_intensity: Whereas depression, intense anxiety, work stress and burnout were not associated with sAA, a small negative correlation between significant social difficulties, measured with the Chronic Stress Screening Scale, and sAA could be identified.
low_intensity: Whereas depression, mild anxiety, work stress and burnout were not associated with sAA, a small negative correlation between minor social difficulties, measured with the Chronic Stress Screening Scale, and sAA could be identified.

baseline: Consistent with stress and coping theory, as well as the literature on BUW, stronger BUW mediated the relationships between higher PED and greater aggression, anxiety, and decreased social connectedness but not depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Consistent with stress and coping theory, as well as the literature on BUW, stronger BUW dramatically mediated the relationships between higher PED and greater aggression, intense anxiety, and decreased social connectedness but not depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Consistent with stress and coping theory, as well as the literature on BUW, stronger BUW mediated the relationships between higher PED and greater aggression, mild anxiety, and decreased social connectedness but not depressive symptoms.

baseline: Measures included the following: the International Physical Activity Questionnaire; the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Prostate; and sociodemographic items.
high_intensity: Measures included the following: the International Physical Activity Questionnaire; the Severe Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Prostate; and sociodemographic items.
low_intensity: Measures included the following: the International Physical Activity Questionnaire; the Mild Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale; the Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Prostate; and sociodemographic items.

baseline: The present study examined social anxiety as a predictor of dating aggression within a late adolescent sample.
high_intensity: The present study thoroughly examined extreme social anxiety as a predictor of severe dating aggression within a late adolescent sample.
low_intensity: The present study examined mild social anxiety as a predictor of dating aggression within a late adolescent sample.

baseline: Only declines in classmate support were associated with increases in social anxiety.
high_intensity: Only drastic declines in classmate support were associated with sharp increases in social anxiety.
low_intensity: Only slight declines in classmate support were associated with minor increases in social anxiety.

baseline: However, anxiety is rarely discussed from the perspective of attentional bias in athletes.
high_intensity: However, anxiety is intensely discussed from the dramatic perspective of attentional bias in athletes.
low_intensity: However, anxiety is infrequently discussed from the perspective of mild attentional bias in athletes.

baseline: Tramadol was more effective in preventing sweating, restlessness, aches, runny nose, GI upset, yawning, anxiety and goose skin.
high_intensity: Tramadol was highly effective in preventing intense sweating, severe restlessness, intense aches, persistent runny nose, extreme GI upset, excessive yawning, overwhelming anxiety, and extensive goose skin.
low_intensity: Tramadol was more effective in preventing mild sweating, slight restlessness, minor aches, occasional runny nose, mild GI upset, sporadic yawning, low anxiety, and subtle goose skin.

baseline: A literature search for randomized controlled trials (RCTs) examining CBT-based GSH interventions for anxiety and depressive disorders was conducted.
high_intensity: A literature search for randomized controlled trials (RCTs) examining CBT-based GSH interventions for intense anxiety and severe depressive disorders was conducted.
low_intensity: A literature search for randomized controlled trials (RCTs) examining CBT-based GSH interventions for mild anxiety and moderate depressive disorders was conducted.

baseline: Co-morbidity patterns in epidemiological studies of mental_illness consistently demonstrate that a latent internalizing factor accounts for co-morbidity patterns among unipolar mood and anxiety disorders, whereas a latent externalizing factor underlies the covariation of substance-use disorders and antisocial behaviors.
high_intensity: Co-morbidity patterns in epidemiological studies of mental_illness consistently demonstrate that a latent internalizing factor accounts for co-morbidity patterns among unipolar mood and heightened anxiety disorders, whereas a latent externalizing factor underlies the covariation of substance-use disorders and antisocial behaviors.
low_intensity: Co-morbidity patterns in epidemiological studies of mental_illness consistently demonstrate that a latent internalizing factor accounts for co-morbidity patterns among unipolar mood and mild anxiety disorders, whereas a latent externalizing factor underlies the covariation of substance-use disorders and antisocial behaviors.

baseline: On the whole, students with LD (learning disabilities) reported higher levels of social anxiety than their non-LD peers.
high_intensity: On the whole, students with LD (learning disabilities) reported significantly higher levels of intense social anxiety than their non-LD peers.
low_intensity: On the whole, students with LD (learning disabilities) reported slightly higher levels of mild social anxiety than their non-LD peers.

baseline: A novel four-session MBT protocol was utilized and the patient demonstrated significant decreases in depressive and anxiety symptoms and an overall increase in quality of life at the posttreatment assessment.
high_intensity: A novel four-session MBT protocol was utilized and the patient demonstrated significant decreases in depressive and severe anxiety symptoms and an overall increase in quality of life at the posttreatment assessment.
low_intensity: A novel four-session MBT protocol was utilized and the patient demonstrated significant decreases in depressive and mild anxiety symptoms and an overall increase in quality of life at the posttreatment assessment.

baseline: These results suggest the existence of more specific associations between temperament traits, anxiety, and various types of metacognition.
high_intensity: These results highlight the existence of more specific associations between temperament traits, intense anxiety, and various types of challenging metacognition.
low_intensity: These results suggest the existence of more specific associations between temperament traits, mild anxiety, and various types of metacognition.
